1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Relmap operators for manipulating term names.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Term
6  ( ropsTerm,
7    -- * pick
8    consPick, relmapPick, relkitPick,
9    -- * cut
10    consCut, relmapCut, relkitCut,
11    -- * pick-term
12    consPickTerm, relmapPickTerm, relkitPickTerm,
13    -- * cut-term
14    consCutTerm, relmapCutTerm, relkitCutTerm,
15    -- * move
16    consMove, relmapMove, relkitMove,
17    -- * rename
18    consRename, relmapRename,
19  ) where
20
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base             as B
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax           as S
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data             as D
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core             as C
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base         as Rop
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message as Msg
27
28
29-- | Relmap operators for manipulating term names.
30--
31--   [@cut@]        Project relation to unspecified terms.
32--
33--   [@cut-term@]   Project relation to terms not in relmap output.
34--
35--   [@pick@]       Project relation to specified terms.
36--
37--   [@pick-term@]  Project relation to terms in relmap output.
38--
39--   [@rename@]     Change term name.
40--
41--   [@move@]       Change heading.
42--
43ropsTerm :: (Ord c) => [C.Rop c]
44ropsTerm = Rop.ropList "term"  -- GROUP
45    --         CONSTRUCTOR        USAGE                      ATTRIBUTE
46    [ Rop.def  consCut            "cut /P ..."               "-term*"
47    , Rop.def  consCutTerm        "cut-term /R"              "-relmap/"
48    , Rop.def  consPick           "pick /P ..."              "-term*"
49    , Rop.def  consPickTerm       "pick-term /R"             "-relmap/"
50    , Rop.def  consRename         "rename /N /P ..."         "-term*"
51    , Rop.def  consMove           "move /P ... -to /N ..."   "-from* . -to"
52    ]
53
54
55-- ----------------------  pick & cut
56
57-- | __pick \/P ...__
58--
59--   Construct @pick@ relmap operator
60--   for relational projection by picking terms.
61--
62consPick :: C.RopCons c
63consPick med =
64  do ns <- Rop.getTerms med "-term"
65     Right $ relmapPick med ns
66
67-- | Create @pick@ relmap.
68relmapPick :: C.Intmed c -> [S.TermName] -> C.Relmap c
69relmapPick med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitPick
70
71-- | Create @pick@ relkit.
72relkitPick :: [S.TermName] -> C.RelkitFlow c
73relkitPick = relkitProject (D.ssRShare, D.ssRShare)
74
75-- | __cut \/P ...__
76--
77--   Construct @cut@ relmap operator
78--   for relational projection by cutting terms.
79--   This operator is an inversion of @pick@.
80--
81consCut :: C.RopCons c
82consCut med =
83  do ns <- Rop.getTerms med "-term"
84     Right $ relmapCut med ns
85
86-- | Create @cut@ relmap.
87relmapCut :: C.Intmed c -> [S.TermName] -> C.Relmap c
88relmapCut med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitCut
89
90-- | Create @cut@ relkit.
91relkitCut :: [S.TermName] -> C.RelkitFlow c
92relkitCut = relkitProject (D.ssRSide, D.ssRSide)
93
94
95-- ----------------------  pick-term & cut-term
96
97-- | __pick-term R__
98--
99--   Construct @pick-term@ relmap operator.
100--   This operator is similar to @pick@
101--   instead of given terms but relation terms.
102--
103consPickTerm :: C.RopCons c
104consPickTerm med =
105  do rmap <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
106     Right $ relmapPickTerm med rmap
107
108-- | Create @pick-term@ relmap.
109relmapPickTerm :: C.Intmed c -> C.Relmap c -> C.Relmap c
110relmapPickTerm med = C.relmapBinary med relkitPickTerm
111
112-- | Create @pick-term@ relkit.
113relkitPickTerm :: C.RelkitBinary c
114relkitPickTerm = relkitProjectTerm (D.ssRShare, D.ssRShare)
115
116-- | __cut-term R__
117--
118--   Construct @cut-term@ relmap operator.
119--   This operator is similar to @cut@
120--   instead of given terms but relation terms.
121--
122consCutTerm :: C.RopCons c
123consCutTerm med =
124  do rmap <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
125     Right $ relmapCutTerm med rmap
126
127-- | Create @cut-term@ relmap.
128relmapCutTerm :: C.Intmed c -> C.Relmap c -> C.Relmap c
129relmapCutTerm med = C.relmapBinary med relkitCutTerm
130
131-- | Create @cut-term@ relkit.
132relkitCutTerm :: C.RelkitBinary c
133relkitCutTerm = relkitProjectTerm (D.ssRSide, D.ssRSide)
134
135
136-- ----------------------  project
137
138relkitProjectTerm :: D.TermPick2 D.TypeTerm c -> C.RelkitBinary c
139relkitProjectTerm _ (C.Relkit _ Nothing _) = const $ Right C.relkitNothing
140relkitProjectTerm lrMap (C.Relkit _ (Just he2) _) =
141    relkitProject lrMap $ D.getTermNames he2
142
143relkitProject :: D.TermPick2 D.TypeTerm c -> [S.TermName] -> C.RelkitFlow c
144relkitProject _ _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
145relkitProject (hePick, boPick) ns (Just he1)
146    | D.newTermsExist pk  = Msg.unkTerm (D.newTerms pk) he1
147    | otherwise           = Right kit2
148    where
149      pk    = D.termPicker ns he1
150      he2   = hePick pk `D.headMap` he1
151      kit2  = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToOne True $ boPick pk
152
153
154-- ----------------------  move
155
156-- | __move \/P ... -to \/N ...__
157--
158--   Construct @move@ relmap operator for renaming term names.
159--   Terms \/P ... of input relation are renamed corresponding terms \/N ....
160--   The @move@ operator provides same functionality as @rename@.
161--   Operator @move@ is suitable for renaming few terms,
162--   operator @rename@ for many terms.
163--   The following relmaps have same effect:
164--
165--   > rename /N /P /N /P ...
166--   > move /P ... -to /N ...
167--
168consMove :: C.RopCons c
169consMove med =
170  do ps <- Rop.getTerms med "-from"
171     ns <- Rop.getTerms med "-to"
172     Right $ relmapMove med (ps, ns)
173
174-- | Create @move@ relmap.
175relmapMove :: C.Intmed c -> ([S.TermName], [S.TermName]) -> C.Relmap c
176relmapMove med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitMove
177
178-- | Create @move@ relkit.
179relkitMove :: ([S.TermName], [S.TermName]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
180relkitMove _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
181relkitMove (ps, ns) (Just he1)
182    | B.notSameLength ps ns  = Msg.oddAttr
183    | B.duplicated ps        = Msg.dupTerm ps   -- from terms
184    | B.duplicated ns        = Msg.dupTerm ns   -- to terms
185    | B.duplicated ns2       = Msg.dupTerm ns2  -- output names
186    | D.newTermsExist pk     = Msg.unkTerm (D.newTerms pk) he1
187    | otherwise              = Right kit2
188    where
189      pk             = D.termPicker ps he1
190      he2            = D.headMap terms he1
191      ns2            = D.getTermNames he2
192      kit2           = C.relkitJust he2 C.RelkitId
193      ni             = zip ns $ D.pickTermsIndex pk
194      terms nt       = foldr term nt ni
195      term (n, i)    = move n `B.mapAt` i
196      move n (_, t)  = (n, t) -- name and type
197
198
199-- ----------------------  rename
200
201-- | __rename \/N \/P \/N \/P ...__
202--
203--   Construct @rename@ relmap operator for renaming term names.
204--   Term \/P is renamed to term \/N for each pair of terms \/N \/P.
205--   The @rename@ operator provides same functionality as @move@.
206--
207consRename :: C.RopCons c
208consRename med =
209  do np <- Rop.getTermPairs med "-term"
210     Right $ relmapRename med np
211
212-- | Create @rename@ relmap.
213relmapRename :: C.Intmed c -> [S.TermName2] -> C.Relmap c
214relmapRename med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitMove . unzip . map B.swap
